block.para: We encounter projections of objects onto planar surfaces on a daily basis, for example in the form of the shadow of an object.

info.para: In this picture, \text{pr}(\Vect{x}) is the projection of \Vect{x} onto H, parallel to \Vect{v}. Similarly, \text{pr}(\Vect{y}) is the projection of \Vect{y} onto H, parallel to \Vect{v}.

block.para: Here the vectors \Vect{x} and \Vect{y} are being projected onto the hyperspace H, parallel to the vector \Vect{v}. The result of this projection are the vectors \text{pr}(\Vect{x}) and \text{pr}(\Vect{y}) in H, respectively.
